paper_abstract: For any arbitrary real number a, the general Randic index R(alpha)(G) of a graph G, is defined as Sigma(uv is an element of E(G))(d(u)d(v))(alpha), where uv is an edge of G, d(u) is the degree of vertex u in G. In this paper we characterize the structures of extremal chemical trees with the minimum general Randic index and give the structure of chemical graphs with minimum general Randic index, for -1 < alpha < 0.
paper_title: A Lower Bound of the General Randic Index of Chemical Graphs
